ratings.comment: Dr. Barta was really nice and you could tell she cared about her students. For being a one credit class I do feel like there was a good amount of time I had to put into it, and it might have just been our TA but there was a high expectation of quality of work that I wasn't expecting for an easy A class I assumed. Just take music 113 and save tears

Dr. Barta is a caring, knowledgable, and will do whatever she can to help you get research opportunities. CHEM260 really prepared me for research lab expectations and how to get your foot in the door. Without her, I wouldn't be working in a lab this summer. She is always willing to talk outside of class and help you!
avoid at all costs. i had huge family issues going on during the semester and she did not accommodate me in the least, ended up costing me an A in the class.

I thought Dr. Barta was a great professor. She made the material interesting, and she was very helpful during office hours. Of course this class is going to be hard; it's a gen chem weed out. But I thought her exams were fair if you put effort into the class.
I thought she was much better than my 103 professor. Challenging course but presents the material well and makes it applicable to everyday life.

Cheri seemed more interested in doing very elementary examples in class than in explaining the key concepts of the course. Exams and weekly quizzes are hard and full of tricks. Teaches the class like an elementary course, tests and grades much harder. Does not curve tests or quizzes and seems to want the class average to be a C

This class seemed like it wasn't going to be too bad but it seems like it gets worse everyday. It seems really hard to get an A and the tests are super hard. There are 3 midterms and 1 final exam along with weekly quizzes.

She makes the tests MUCH more hard than they need to be, and she doesn't curve any of the tests. So right now, the class average is a C, but she doesn't seem to care. I feel like she needs to give more partial points on exams, as well as make them much easier and comprehensible.

Dr. Barta is a good teacher. However, she makes it very hard to give an A and and sometimes contradicts herself and gives you more assignments. I found it impossible to get an A. Another problem of hers is that she over babies you. One time in lecture she did four examples of the same problem. Very unnecessary.

She treats us like we don't know anything. It is very frustrating when we have to waste 20 minutes on simple algebraic steps. Her lectures are EXTREMELY BORING. All her slides are word for word from the textbook. The only reason why I go to class is because attendance is mandatory. I don't learn anything from her, and her voice is annoying.

I really liked Dr.Barta. Her class was organized and she presented topics clearly. If you don't understand something she's more than willing to help. The tests weren't too bad. Read the book along with the lecture and study her objective sheets before the exam and you should be fine.
She's very helpful and makes lecture somewhat interesting. Tests are somewhat difficult, but very manageable. Start studying like a week before and you should be fine.
The class is pretty easy and she is very helpful during office hours and after lecture
Lecture isn't bad. Very willing to help students. Good professor overall
